attributes.action: LACK OF CARING PROFFESSION FOR CANCER PATIENTS IN BIRMINGHAM
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
No 24 hour advice, care or clinical support is not available for patients in Birmingham.   
Patient care in Birmingham is backed up by other charities like the Samarthans and the NHS Direct. 
Care is not listed on www.nhs.uk website under post code B1.  

A recognised cancer nurse helpline is closed out of office hours and is operated by officers who lack clinical knowledge.  
A cancer patient in need of support should never be expected to get an answerphone response out of normal office hours 
and be told, if they need emotional support to ring another charity.  This signifies lack of care and clinical support.

Recognised cancer nurses have no link with the expert care provided by Hospice nurses and this needs to be made clear to patients. 

Birmingham needs a 24 hour advice, care and clinical support for patients, the second biggest City in the UK. 
The new Queen Elizabeth Hospital opens in 2010 making it a leader in cancer expertise. 
Patients need care and support in Birmingham where a major lack of resource exists. 

Cancer may take the patients life but at least, leave the patient with their pride. 

A cancer patient should not have to ask for a nurse if it is a caring profession.
